about.title: About Me
about.description:
Creative director, mentor, designer, web developer, 3D visualizator and digital artist



My passion lies at the intersection of design and technology, where I create interactive, aesthetic, and immersive experiences...

A versatile and passionate creator who can handle various aspects of digital media production. Whether it's designing stunning visuals, animating engaging motion graphics.
text: I have more than 11 years of experience in various fields of design, animation, and web development. I love to craft beautiful and engaging solutions for different kinds of projects, from branding and logo design to motion graphics and interactive websites. I'm always eager to learn new skills and technologies to enhance my creative potential and expand my portfolio. I love to collaborate with clients and partners who share my vision and values.

You can also contact me anytime via email or social media.
Thank you for visiting and I hope to hear from you soon!

moreContent.title: More Content
moreContent.text: Adding more content to make the page scrollable and test the behavior of Scroll across different pages.

works.title: My Works
works.intro: Here you can see a selection of my projects. Each of them is a story of collaboration, creativity, and technical skill.

projects.title: A Stroll On The Beach
projects.description: Creating a 3D model and poster in the style of cartoons from the Pixar Animation Studios.
projects.fullDescriptionOne:
Target:

Creating a 3D model and poster in the style of cartoons from the Pixar Animation Studios. The personage should be similar in appearance and character to the client's daughter. The main requirements are beach sand, bright lighting, a happy expression, balloons, shells, starfish...


Soft:

Zbrush, Blender, Adobe Photoshop



The first step was to find a reference photo of the client's daughter and sketch her face and body in a cartoonish way. I used a software called Blender to create the 3D model and applied some basic materials and textures to it. I also added some hair and clothing details to make her look more realistic.
projects.fullDescriptionTwo: The final step was to add some balloons and pose the character in a happy expression. I used a curve modifier to make the balloons look like they are floating in the air and attached them to the character's hand with a string. I also adjusted the facial features and body posture of the character to make her look cheerful and excited.

projects.title: Spheres
projects.description: Creating immersive 360° video content specifically designed for LED media spheres to deliver a fully captivating and dynamic visual experience.
projects.fullDescriptionOne:
Target:

Creating video content on the topic of "natural elements" in 360° (VR) format. This would be a great way to showcase the beauty and diversity of nature, as well as to provide an immersive and educational experience for the viewers.
The project would involve using software such as "Blender", "After Effects" and "Premiere Pro" to create realistic and stunning 3D models and animations of various natural elements, such as water, fire, earth, and air.
The final product would be compatible with VR devices and platforms, such as LED Media-Spheres.


Soft:

Blender, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe Photoshop
projects.TextParalax:
"..At the entrance of the building, screen balls are placed under the ceiling, which broadcast 360° of environmental content.."

UNK corporate interiors
projects.fullDescriptionTwo:
"...The architects preferred not to continue the idea of green facades in the interior literally - at the expense of living plants. Therefore, the eco-theme is embodied here by figurative means. The project is based on the idea of biomes (biological environments such as, for example, desert, tundra, ocean, etc.). At the entrance of the building, screen balls are placed under the ceiling, which broadcast 360 degrees of environmental content specially created for the project (each ball has its own biome)." - UNK corporate interiors





Full project review - UNK corporate interiors, Officenext

projects.title: Theatre ATX
projects.description: Website design and development for the 'Academy of Theater Arts' with a retro aesthetic inspired by the early 2000s.
projects.fullDescriptionOne:
"Theatre ATX (Academy of Theater Arts) - was founded in Russia, Saratov City on November 20, 1988. The first (and only) president (artistic director) of the "Academy" Ivan Ivanovich Verkhovykh, a graduate of the acting department of the I.A. Slonov and the directing department of the Higher Theater School named after B.V. Shchukin. While still an actor of the Saratov Youth Theater, he created three theater studios in Saratov, from which the theater arose over time: eight of the then studio members became a kind of core of the team." - Theatre ATX


Target:

The main idea was to create a website that would look like it was made in the early 2000s, using the tools and techniques that were available at that time. I wanted to recreate the aesthetic and functionality of websites from that era, such as the use of frames, tables, animated GIFs, marquees, pop-ups, and so on.



Soft:

Denwer, Visual Studio Code, CMS Joomla, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop
projects.TextParalax:
"Freedom will become law, and law will become freedom. You will return and never be a slave. Neither you, nor your children."

I. Verkhovoy (Theatre ATX)
projects.fullDescriptionTwo:
The theater's style is influenced by Suprematism and Bauhaus, two artistic movements that emphasized geometric shapes, colors and functionality. I incorporated some elements from these movements into the site design, such as the use of black, white and yellow, the contrast between straight and curved lines, and the balance between form and content. The site has a retro feel, but also a modern touch. It showcases the theater's history, vision and performances in a clear and engaging way.




Photos are taken from the official website of - Theatre ATX

projects.title: Shut Up & Game
projects.description: Create logo and poster for YouTube channel.
projects.fullDescriptionOne:
This project is a comprehensive visual design initiative aimed at creating a distinctive and stylish visual identity for a gaming-focused YouTube channel — "Shut up & game". The scope of the project includes the development of a logo, a poster, and various visual elements using professional design tools such as Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop.



Soft:

Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop
projects.fullDescriptionTwo: The primary goal of this project is to establish a bold and memorable brand style that effectively conveys the channel’s gaming theme, engages the target audience, and helps it stand out in the competitive world of gaming media.

projects.title: Sound Design
projects.description: A photorealistic digital image of a old Fender Stratocaster guitar connected to a Marshall amplifier, for a poster.
projects.fullDescriptionOne:
Target:

Develop a photorealistic digital art depicting a old Fender Stratocaster guitar plugged into a Marshall amplifier. The workflow involves creating 3D models and setting up the scene in Blender, then refining the image to perfection using post-processing tools in Photoshop.



Soft:

Blender, Adobe Photoshop
projects.fullDescriptionTwo: Accurate 3D models of the Fender Stratocaster guitar and Marshall amplifier were created. Special attention was paid to the details, from the shape of the guitar body to the texture of the amplifier's vinyl covering and its knobs. The image was refined in Photoshop for maximum photorealism, transforming the 3D render into a complete artistic composition.

projects.title: AI Artworks
projects.description: This gallery showcases my digital generative artwork, created over a period of time.
projects.fullDescriptionOne: I utilize a wide range of powerful image generation models, such as Flux, SDXL, and many more.
